Photography

The focus of our photography is to capture our people â€” the expert, helpful, results-obsessed and confident group that is at the core of our brand. Below are four pillars that are represented in our photography.

Solo Rackers

Solo shots highlight Rackers in a biographical approach. Catching candid and authentic moments help display the personality of the brand.

Support

The support that Rackspace offers is second to none. There is a redundancy of support and knowledge that runs throughout Rackspace. A Racker with a headset is someone who is empowered to direct a problem toward the right solution.

Collaboration

Groups of two or more Rackers working together shows the chemistry and commitment to solving problems and providing support. For every Racker on the phone with a customer, there is a group working together behind the scenes crafting a solution.

Knowledge Sharing

Rackers are always working to find new ways to provide support. The willingness to work together by sharing ideas and knowledge helps create a level of expertise that is always being built upon.

Photographic Best Practices

NEED TO REPLACE

  • One Racker within a group looking toward the camera helps the viewer feel engaged at the ground level.
  • Solo Racker photos can be candid or staged, but should still feel authentic, capturing natural emotions.
  • Outside of showing scale, photos should aim to capture emotions. We should feel close enough to a Racker to feel a connection to what they are thinking, what problem they are solving, or simply a bit about their personality.
Banners

Our banners are the leading graphic element on all pages and therefore one of our largest vehicles for our brand on the page. They contain page titles and we want to make sure that we lead with our best foot forward.

Addition Photographic Requirements for Web Banners:

  • To be used full width so at least 2000k pixels wide - larger if possible.
  • The subject or person is off to the left or right to not interfere with centered text
  • No outdated technology
  • High Quality
  • Full Color (not black and white)
  • Doesn't contain any predominant non-rackspace logos

IMAC Banner Options

These banner types should be used on IMAC campaign pages. A CTA option is included within all banners sections, but is not necessary to use.

Large IMAC Banner

This banner should be used for headlines between 70 and 90 characters long. The image area is larger and the box width is wider to accommodate for longer headlines.

Do not use this banner for shorter headlines in order to have a larger banner image area. The banner is dictated by headline length/size.

we guarantee a 99.99% openstack API uptime.
And yes, that .01% does keep us up at night

Read Our Case Studies
Medium IMAC Banner

This banner should be used for headlines between 50 and 70 characters long. The image area and box width is medium-sized to accommodate for moderate headlines.

the cloud is a mystery wrapped in a riddle.
We can unwrap it for you

Small IMAC Banner

This banner should be used for headlines under 50 characters long. The image area and box width is small to accommodate for our much shorter headlines.

Do not use this banner for larger headlines in order to have a smaller banner image area. The banner is dictated by headline length/size.

The cloud runs on its own,
with lots of help
